sub_title: Former State Prosecutor @ South African National Prosecuting Authority.  People orientated. Problem solver.
summary:
Worked for SA Government since 1995, state prosecutor since 1998-2020.

 Took a leap of faith and resigned 30 April 2020 (during COVID-19!) to pursue other opportunities in compliance/investigations/witness assistance or anything interesting...

Loyalty is important but so is living life!

treasury_media.title: Traffic officer jailed for R200 bribery | Die Pos
treasury_media.description: Former national traffic officer, Rodney Dakalo Ramusia (29), was sentenced to six years in jail for corruption by the Mokopane Regional Court on Monday 3 June.

treasury_media.title: Jail time for 2 Limpopo cops who asked foreign national for R500 bribe | News24
treasury_media.description: Two Limpopo police officers are to spend the next five years in jail for asking an undocumented immigrant for a R500 bribe to avoid arrest.

treasury_media.title: News | Life sentence for rapist
treasury_media.description: LEPHALALE – Convicted rapist, Jan Monanyane (22), received a life sentence in the Lephalale regional court on Thursday for the kidnapping and rape of a woman (21) in June 2011.

treasury_media.title: Man gets 80 years for cattle theft
treasury_media.description: A man was reportedly sentenced to 80 years in jail for stealing R2m worth of cattle and goats in Limpopo and the North West.

courses.name: Crime Scene Management in Rhino Poaching (2011)
Digital Sherlocks Training Program by Atlantic Council’s Digital Forensic Research Lab, 2020
Judicial Skills Course for Aspirant Magistrates (2014)

profile_positions.description:
-Prosecute in both District and Regional Courts.
-Cases include murder, rape, illegal drug possession, house breaking, vehicle theft, illegal gambling and illegal gambling houses, corruption, serious fraud and money laundering, environmental wildlife cases such as illegal hunting, rhinoceros and lion poaching & pangolin cases involving syndicates, critical infrastructure offences.
-Specialist in prosecuting illegal rhinoceros hunting and removal of horns cases.  
-Guiding police and law enforcement agencies in the investigation of cases.
-Researching case law and statutes, drafting charge sheets, present evidentiary material.
-Requesting, analyzing and preparing bank statement evidence in fraud and corruption matters for court purposes.
-Requesting, analyzing and preparing cell phone records of suspects.  
-Screening of dockets and placement on the court roll.
-Drafting ‘heads of arguments’/submissions regarding facts, demeanor of witnesses, cross examination of the accused & case law, including procedural aspects.
-Trial preparation: summary of evidence & witness consultation.
-Prepare disclosure and submit timeously.
-Inquest evaluation.
-Training of medical practitioners in the completion of the forensic medical report and proper handling and sealing of exhibits taken from rape victims. 
-Maintenance prosecutor – handling of ‘formal’ maintenance matters & mediation between parties, maintenance inquiries, issuing of summonses
-Prosecuted rape and sexual abuse cases involving both adult & minor victims and leading the evidence of children through a close circuit television with the assistance of an intermediary.  
-Handling of bail applications. 
-Handling ‘decision dockets’ of a technical nature.
-Compilation of daily and monthly court statistics.
-Dealing with complaints & representations by the public.
-Handling of correspondence, reports and recommendations to and from the Office of the Director of Public Prosecutions & legal representatives.
profile_positions.title: State Prosecutor

company.name: Department of Justice and Constitutional Development

profile_positions.company: Department of Justice and Constitutional Development
profile_positions.description:
Bursary received from the Department of Justice. Worked 6 months p/a as an administrative clerk in various sections and studied 6 months p/a at the Justice College for a period of 3 years.

Administrative clerk
	Clerk of the civil court – Handling & issuing of summonses, warrants of executions & the opening of administrative files.
	Clerk of the Criminal court – Handling and filing of court cases, warrants of arrests, preparing appeals for submittal to the High Court & closing of court books
	Receiving payments on traffic fines, assisting public with enquiries, typing of letters and charge sheets.
	Filing of court documents.
	Typing of legal correspondence.
	Clerk at the Office of the Regional Court President assisted in reading and spell checking of documents pertaining to a Commission of Inquiry into the importing of material containing copper arsenate & the filing of relevant documents.
	Delivering of legal documents & court schedules to Regional court magistrates & handling of phone calls to assist the secretary of the Office of the Regional Court President.  Filing of test judgments of aspirant magistrates & handling of temporary appointment documents of magistrates. 
	Clerk of the Inquest Court – dealing & keeping inquest registers up to date, receiving of inquest dockets, handling of inquest enquiries, assisting prosecutors in preparing Inquest dockets for magistrates, assisting family members of deceased persons & attorneys in obtaining copies of inquest records.
profile_positions.title: Administrative Clerk & Student

profile_positions.company: Department of Justice and Constitutional Development
